III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 08/08/2025, Youth A became upset during toothbrushing
check in, so he snatched a mini flashlight necklace off his neck
and threw it on the floor. Youth A then took the toothpaste, threw it
on the floor and began stomping the toothpaste. As a result,
Administrator 1 punched Youth A in the gut causing Jordan to fall
into the tub. Youth A began crying and screaming. Minutes later,
Administrator 1 hit Youth A two more times. It is unknown where
Youth A was hit, it is unknown if Youth A sustained any marks or
bruises or sought medical attention.
Investigation Administrator 1 was interviewed via phone on 8/11/2025. He
reported never hitting Youth A and came upon the bathroom when
Youth A was dysregulated after Staff 1 pushed Youth A to finish.
He reported when Staff 1 hurried Youth A, Youth A became
flustered and began to get aggressive. Administrator 1 reported
Youth A had fallen after slipping in the bathroom and when trying
to assist Youth A to a standing position, Administrator 1 placed his
hand on Youth A’s back. Because Youth A had received a
sunburn earlier in the day (Administrator 1 denied knowing this
information) when Youth A’s back was touched, Youth A
screamed out loud. Administrator 1 reported Staff 1 left the
bathroom right after Administrator 1 entered the bathroom and
never came back to look in on Youth A. Administrator 1 reported
Staff 1 struggles with her own trauma and informed Administrator
1 that she heard her father beat her mother causing Staff 1’s
trauma. Administrator 1 was interviewed again face to face at
the facility with MDHHS Worker 1 on 8/11/2025. He reported
Youth A, and the other youth (Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D)
went to a “back to school bash” during the day and spent time
there from 8:00 am to approximately 5:00 pm. Once back to the
facility, Administrator 1 informed the youth they needed to take
showers and rest for the remainder of the evening. He reported
2

Staff 1 was the second shift staff on duty at the time. He described
Staff 1 as having issues (feeling overwhelmed) in the past with the
youth but also being a nice and passive individual. He believed
the youth would take advantage of Staff 1 at times because she is
passive. Administrator 1 reported Youth A’s medication has
changed (taken off by physician at Family Health Center of
Risperidone and placed on Seroquel) and because of this change,
Youth A has struggled with aggression at times. He described
Youth A as a “really good kid” who gets “upset quickly at times”.
He again reported because Staff 1 was pushing Youth A to hurry,
Youth A became upset and began destroying stuff (toothpaste,
hygiene caddy, and pen flashlight) in the bathroom. Staff 1 is
reported to have run out of the bathroom and asked Administrator
1 to intervene. Administrator 1 found Youth A in a rage, so he
attempted to deescalate Youth A. Administrator 1 gave the same
report as what he gave on the phone earlier. He attempted to
assist Youth A up but because of Youth A’s sunburn on his back,
when touched by Administrator 1, Youth A screamed out loud.
Once Youth A began to calm down and become emotionally
regulated, Administrator 1 took Youth A to Youth A’s bedroom and
Youth A began to relax. Administrator 1 shared a belief that Staff 1
must have thought Administrator 1 was abusing Youth A because
of the scream. Administrator 1 reported Staff 1 said “I can’t do
this” and left the building. Administrator 1 was asked about the
allegations and what Staff 1 could see. He reported she had left
the area and could not see what was occurring in the bathroom
even with the door open (which it was). Administrator 1 reported
Law Enforcement and a MDHHS worker came to the facility later
that night and observed Youth A. MDHHS Worker 2 came to the
facility the next day to interview Youth A. Administrator 1 denied
ever pushing or punching Youth A. He reported the other three
youth (Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D) in the milieu area were
about 10’ away. The other staff in the facility at the time were Staff
2 and Staff 4 (came to work after the incident) but she was in the
dining room area and did not witness any of the incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility with MDHHS
Worker 1 on 8/11/2025. She reported working on Friday
(8/8/2025 day of incident) from 8:00 am to 4:30 pm and not
witnessing any of the incident except Staff 1 rushing out of the
building. She reported knowing Youth A can be defiant and
indicated almost all the staff will have issues with Youth A at times
because of his defiance. She believes when redirected, Youth A
does well. She reported overhearing Staff 1 asking Youth A to
brush Youth A’s teeth and Youth A responded by saying Youth A
had already brushed his teeth. She denied hearing any yelling or
3

screaming from Youth A. She reported not observing
Administrator 1 go into the bathroom to assist but did have Staff 1
walk past Staff 2 on Staff 1’s way out of the building. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 looked in a panic and upset. Staff 2 reported not
speaking to Staff 1 after Staff 1 left the building. She reported the
facility stayed in ratio because Staff 4 came on duty as this time.
She denied ever observing Administrator 1 become physical with
any youth nor has she heard any youth complain about
Administrator 1.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility with
MDHHS Worker 1 on 8/11/2025. He reported remembering the
“bash” on Friday and getting back to the facility. He reported
taking a shower, doing chores, eating, then watching television
and described this as “chilled out” until bedtime. Youth B reported
not remembering anything involving Youth A because he was not
paying attention but remembered Staff 1 was on duty that
evening. Youth B reported staying to himself as much as possible
and never hearing any yelling or screaming. Youth B reported
feeling safe at the facility and really enjoying the food and staff
interactions. He has never observed staff becoming physical with
youth and staff always talk youth down. Youth B described
Administrator 1 as “chill, cool, and a man of his word”.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility with
MDHHS Worker 1 on 8/11/2025. Youth C reported being at the
facility for the past two weeks and really likes everything about the
program. He reported never witnessing staff mistreat youth or
place hands on a youth. He reported no awareness of the
situation involving Youth A and there is nothing he doesn’t like
about the program. He reported feeling safe at the facility.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility with
MDHHS Worker 1 on 8/11/2025. Youth A reported not knowing
why he was being interviewed and described Friday as helping at
the “bash” before coming back to the facility. He reported getting a
sunburn during the day and taking a shower when back at the
facility. Youth A reported slipping on water on the floor after
brushing his teeth and having Administrator 1 help him up. He
reported Staff 1 was the staff on duty at the time and
understanding that Staff 1 said Administrator 1 had hit Youth A.
He denied this allegation and stated again, Administrator 1 was
only helping him up after falling. Youth A reported Administrator 1
informed him that Staff 1 said Administrator 1 had hit Youth A.
Youth A was asked about being upset and reported Staff 1 told
him to brush his teeth again after he had already brushed his
4

teeth. Youth A reported Administrator 1 helped Youth A up and
there was no physical abuse involved. He reported yelling when
Administrator 1 helped him up from the floor. Youth A reported
feeling safe at the facility and having others to talk to when upset.
He identified his roommate (Youth D) as his primary support at
times. He was unable to identify anything he dislikes about the
program and has never witnessed any staff become physical with
youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility with MDHHS
Worker 1 on 8/11/2025. She reported working on the day of the
allegations but left work at approximately 2:00 pm and her title is
Lead Director. She reported first hearing about something with
Youth A when she received a phone call from Staff 4 who
indicated Law Enforcement and MDHHS were at the door and
wanted to speak to Youth A around 11:00 pm. Staff 3 contacted
Administrator 1 when she arrived at work Saturday morning and
Administrator 1 informed her of the situation. Staff 3 described
Staff 1 as having a lot of things going on in her life such as
working another job and going to school. Staff 3 indicated a belief
that Staff 1 was getting ready to quit because Staff 1 was feeling
overwhelmed. Staff 1 tended to take things personal and would
struggle emotionally at time. Staff 3 was asked to describe the
interactions between Administrator 1 and the youth and she stated
that Administrator 1 is “very good with the kids”. Administrator 1 is
“very comfortable with the youth and the youth love him”. Staff 3
reported never witnessing Administrator 1 becoming physical with
any youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility with MDHHS
Worker 2 on 8/11/2025. She reported Administrator 1, Youth A,
Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D arrived back at the facility around
3:30 pm from a community outing. Administrator 1 told the youth
to take showers. She reported Youth A went into the bathroom
and having to tell Youth A “over and over again to take a shower”
and the next thing she heard was things breaking in the bathroom.
Youth A came out of the shower and became defiant to her orders
to brush Youth A’s teeth. She reported taking a “tone with Youth
A” before Administrator 1 took over for her. She reported
Administrator 1 was standing in the doorway when Youth A
became more frustrated and “stomped on the toothbrush”. Youth
A then ripped off his flashlight pen which was around his neck.
She reported Administrator 1 asked Youth A to stop before
throwing a punch at Youth A. Staff 1 was asked about her location
and she reported standing against the wall but could see Youth A
in the bathroom mirror. She reported after Administrator 1 hit
5

Youth A; Youth A went down over the toilet and fell into the tub. At
this point, Staff 1 reported walking away towards the kitchen. Staff
1 was asked about supervision of the other youth in the home and
reported Staff 2 was supervising the other youth. Needing a break,
Staff 1 left and walked around the block before returning to the
facility. Staff 1 reported trying to make dinner and Administrator 1
asked to speak with her. Staff 1 reported telling Administrator 1
that she didn’t trust him and Youth A needs to be removed from
the facility. Staff 1 reported Administrator 1 denied doing anything
wrong while she sat at the table “shaking”. Staff 1 was asked
about the allegation of Administrator 1 hitting Youth A three times
and she reported only seeing the first punch but knowing
Administrator 1 hit Youth A two other times because she heard a
“smack” which was heard throughout the house. Staff 1 was
asked how she knew Administrator 1 threw a punch and she
reported Administrator 1 “balled up his fist” and they (Youth A and
Administrator 1) were arguing. Staff 1 reported a belief that the
noise of Administrator 1 arguing and hitting Youth A was so loud
that the “whole house heard everything”. Staff 1 reported never
witnessing any aggression by Administrator 1 in the past. When
asked why it was so upsetting for Staff 1, she responded, “it
makes me think of small children in my life” and “I felt trapped by
some abuse in my life”. Staff 1 then stated, “I was not abused as a
kid, but my biological dad would hit my stepmother”.
Youth D was interviewed via phone with MDHHS Worker 1 on
8/13/2025. Youth D reported never witnessing Administrator 1
being inappropriate and he likes Administrator 1 because
Administrator 1 is funny. There is nothing he doesn’t like about his
placement and feels very safe at the facility. Youth D reported
hearing that someone was going to slap Youth A but didn’t see or
hear anything.
Documents Reviewed:
Pine Way Group Aggressive/Assaultive Youth Policy dated
5/22/25. This document outlines that all staff will receive training
on trauma informed verbal techniques to help de-escalate
dysregulated youth. If a youth is assaultive, staff are to exit the
room, leaving the door open and continue to try and verbally de-
escalate the youth.
Pine Way Group Restraint Policy dated 5/22/25. This document
states that the facility does not use any type of restraint under any
circumstances.
6

Pine Way Group Discipline Policy dated 5/18/2020. This
document outlines the program’s guidelines for discipline. It is
documented:
- The policy and procedure regarding discipline is
detailed in the Resident Handbook and the Parent
Handbook.
- Parents/guardians are sent a Parent Handbook within
one week of their youth’s admission at Pine Way Group
Home.
- Youth are provided a Resident Handbook upon
admission at Pine Way Group Home.
- Pine Way Group Home prohibits all cruel and severe
discipline, including any of the following:
o Corporal punishment inflicted in any manner
o Disciplining a group for the misbehavior of
individual group members
o Verbal abuse, ridicule, or humiliation
o Denial of any essential program services,
including adoption planning
o Withholding food or creating special menus for
behavior management purposes.
o Denial of visits or communication with family.
o Denial of opportunity for at least 8 hours of sleep
in a 24-hour period.
o Denial of shelter, clothing, or essential personal
needs.
o Residents shall not be permitted to discipline
other residents.
o Pine Way staff will NOT restrain any youth within
the program.
Pine Way Group CCI incident report dated 8/8/25 authored by
Administrator 1. This document outlines the incident that
occurred in the alleged allegations. It is documented Youth A
became agitated after Staff 1 asked Youth A to brush his teeth a
second time. Youth A began displaying oppositional behavior and
destroying property inside the bathroom. It is documented Staff 1
became frightened and concerned and asked Administrator 1 to
intervene, while exiting the bathroom. Administrator 1 entered the
bathroom and began verbally de-escalating the situation. During
this process, it is documented Youth A fell on items that were
destroyed laying on the floor and Administrator 1 attempted to
stand up Youth A. it is documented physical contact (Administrator
1’s hand) was made with the sunburned area of Youth A’s back
7

and Youth A screamed. Staff 1 hearing the scream from outside of
the bathroom interpreted the scream as physical abuse.
Administrator 1 is documented as successfully de-escalating
Youth A, apologizing to Youth A, and assisting Youth A to Youth
A’s bedroom. When in the bedroom, Administrator 1 administered
Youth A’s prescribed medication and Youth A was calm the rest of
the evening. The follow up actions are documented as Staff 1
confronting Administrator 1 with her belief Administrator 1 had
physically abused Youth A in the bathroom. Administrator 1 is
documented clarifying that no abuse had occurred and that the
cause of the scream was Administrator 1 touching Youth A’s
sunburn. Staff 1 is documented as sharing her own personal story
of her dysfunctional parents relationship of abuse. Staff 1 is also
documented as leaving the shift early.
HR file for Administrator 1 was reviewed and there was no
documentation of discipline in the file nor reported. Administrator 1
is current on his training. Administrator 1 began his employment at
the facility when it opened in 2021.
Video Review:
The cameras are not in working order because the facility has a
CMH contract with does not allow the use of cameras.
Walk-through:
This is a two-story building in excellent condition. The facility is
well maintained, clean and wonderfully furnished. All plumbing is
in working order and the kitchen is well stocked (fresh, frozen, and
dry goods) and all items required to be locked to found to be
locked.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as evidenced by interviews with
staff, youth, and documents. Evidence does not support the
allegations that Administrator 1 hit Youth A while in the bathroom.
Staff 1 stated this occurred, however all others in the home at the
time are denying hearing the scream or other alleged hits by
Administrator 1 as stated by Staff 1 and Youth A denied he was
hit. None of the youth report any fear and all feel safe in the
facility. The youth also appear to have a positive connection with
Administrator 1.
8

TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered regarding employment process
of individuals seeking employment at the facility. It was discussed
that the screening process needs to include a measure of how the
individual deals with stressful situations and any trauma issues
from their own history that influence their ability to provide care.
Technical assistance was offered regarding spelling out in detail
the specific actions prohibited in the licensing rule covering
discipline into their discipline policy. This would be clearer than is
stated in their current policy.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
